meanings.definition: A substance resembling fibrin found in connective tissue.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the fibrinoids in the tissue were similar to fibrin.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the role of fibrinoids in connective tissue health.
meanings.sent3: The fibrinoids in the tissue decided to throw a party for the other proteins.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was as strong and resilient as fibrinoids in connective tissue.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the fibrinoids looked like tiny threads holding everything together.

meanings.definition: A type of protein found in the body.
meanings.sent1: The nutritionist recommended foods rich in fibrinoids for muscle repair.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often consume supplements to boost their fibrinoids levels.
meanings.sent3: The fibrinoids in his body were known for their strength and flexibility.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and essential as fibrinoids in the body.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained how fibrinoids play a crucial role in healing wounds.

meanings.sent1: The fibrous protein fibrinoids provided structure to the tissue.
meanings.sent2: The researcher discovered a new function of fibrinoids as a fibrous protein.
meanings.sent3: The fibrinoids in the protein shake made it extra thick and creamy.
meanings.sent4: His determination was as strong and unyielding as fibrinoids in the body.
meanings.sent5: The artist depicted the intertwining fibrinoids in a beautiful sculpture.
